entrance.title: Reading Room
entrance.description: You are standing in a reading room. There are some desks and chairs on soft carpeted floor, tall shelves line the walls. There is a door behind a counter to the North.

items.name: Leaflet
items.description: The leaflet reads: "Tate Archive collects and makes accessible a wealth of material primarily relating to the history of British art from 1900 to the present."

items.name: Desk
items.description: They are hardwood desks of massive construction with a leather writing surface laid into the top.

items.name: Chair
items.description: The chairs are made of polished steel and soft black leather. Very heavy.

items.name: Counter
items.description: The counter is chest-high, with dark-grey linoleum sides and an oak top. Leaflets are stacked in one corner.

items.name: Shelves
items.description: The shelves reach from floor to ceiling. They are filled with green binders.

items.name: Floor
items.description: The light-grey carpet is so dense you can barely hear your own footsteps.

corridor1.title: Corridor
corridor1.description: You are in a brightly-lit corridor. You see a narrow desk to one side. The walls on either side are made of steel wire mesh painted white, beyond which rows of storage shelves are visible. There is a door to the East.

items.description: Utilitarian. Empty boxes, stacks of documents, paper files, various stationary, and a single blue rubber glove are scattered across the surface.
items.searchDescription: You search the desk. After a little while, you find an access card under a stack of acquisition forms.

items.description: It's made of the same steel wire mesh as the walls, with solid steel hinges. A card reader is attached to the wall next to it.

store1.title: Store 1
store1.description: You're in a vast storage room lit by neon tubes. There is a row of 14 light-grey shelves mounted on steel tracks embedded into the floor. Each shelf has a label and a circular handle attached to the side facing you. You hear a humming noise from the climate control system.

shelves.description: The shelf is made of black and grey sheet metal, and tall enough to require a ladder. Its six levels are filled with binders, envelopes, and boxes of various shapes and sizes. The label reads "TGA 123".

The shelf is made of black and grey sheet metal, and tall enough to require a ladder. Its six levels are filled with binders, envelopes, and boxes of various shapes and sizes. The label reads "TGA 124".

The shelf is made of black and grey sheet metal, and tall enough to require a ladder. Its six levels are filled with binders, envelopes, and boxes of various shapes and sizes. The label reads "TGA 125".

The shelf is made of black and grey sheet metal, and tall enough to require a ladder. Its six levels are filled with binders, envelopes, and boxes of various shapes and sizes. The label reads "TGA 126".

The shelf is made of black and grey sheet metal, and tall enough to require a ladder. Its six levels are filled with binders, envelopes, and boxes of various shapes and sizes. The label reads "TGA 127".

The shelf is made of black and grey sheet metal, and tall enough to require a ladder. Its six levels are filled with binders, envelopes, and boxes of various shapes and sizes. The label reads "TGA 128".

items.descriprion: Steel, polished to a high sheen by repeated use.
You pick up a random box from the shelf. Opening it reveals a stack of neat paper files.

initialInventory.name: Access Card
initialInventory.description: Plastic. You look dead in the picture.

init: You are the archivist. Find TGA431. Start by looking around the room, or type "help" to show a list of available commands.
help: You can interact with the world by typing commands in the format "[verb]" or "[verb] [noun]". Common verbs include "go", "take", "look", "examine", and "use". To move around, type "go" followed by a compass direction like this: "go north". Type "Inventory" to see what you're carrying, and "help" to display this message.
cantGoThatWay: You can't go in that direction
cantTakeThat: Better to leave that where it is.
didntUnderstand: That's not a word I know.
noSuchThing: There is no such thing here.
